author: Miranda Larbi
title: These pals went on a ‘homiemoon’ while all their others mates were busy getting married
text:
(Picture: Imgur/ignoreeverythingido) By the time you get to your late 20s, it seems like every former wreck-head friend has settled down.
All the pals you used to wake up surrounded by empty pizza boxes with are getting married and popping sprogs.
The monk teaching us how to be happy through Twitter And you…you’re still living life like it’s the second year of university – only with more work and more debt.
But just because you don’t have a life partner to commit to, doesn’t mean you should miss out on the best bit of getting married. Just look at Imgur user ignoreeverythingido , who’s just come back from a trip of a lifetime.
‘While everyone else is getting married and having babies, my best friend and I had our homiemoon in Thailand,’ he writes.
Forget sickly sand-drawn hearts in the sand and towel swans on hotel beds, this pair went all round Thailand taking ‘follow me’ pictures wherever they visited.
Together they set out on a magical journey of discovery (Picture: Imgur/ignoreeverythingido)  
Which took them everywhere, from Tonsai beach… (Picture: Imgur/ignoreeverythingido)  
…to the Sunday night market in Chiang Mai (Picture: Imgur/ignoreeverythingido)  
Their homiemoon was blessed many times over (Picture: Imgur/ignoreeverythingido)  
At temple after temple (Picture: Imgur/ignoreeverythingido)  
Even budda got involved (Picture: Imgur/ignoreeverythingido)  
As did a couple of locals (Picture: Imgur/ignoreeverythingido)  
Before finishing their trip with a stop-off in Bangkok (Picture: Imgur/ignoreeverythingido) ‘For reference, my friend is a burley, hilarious, large, orange-beared, kind dude,’ ignoreeverythingido says.
‘Finally the 15 years of friendship has paid off.’
And becoming the definition of bromance/man-bun goals.
